name: Azure SQL Database
description: Azure SQL Database is an adaptation of Microsoft SQL server to the cloud infrastructure.

name: Single-instance message processors
description: Limiting message processing to a single thread can be alluring when the goal is to eliminate duplicate and out-of-order messages. In practice, it reduces their frequency but does not eliminate them, and limits scalability and resiliency. Message processors should strive to be idempotent and tolerant of out-of-order messages.
notes: Need details explaining the streaming (kafka) approach vs the ASB/IQ.M approach

name: Graphite
description: https://github.com/iQmetrix/product-excellence/blob/master/monitoring-and-alerting/graphite.md
notes: Jeff Eggen to find chamption. Docs need updating

name: In order message processing
description: Forcing messages to be processed in the exact order they were published causes many problems for systems processing messages. Message processors should be flexible enough to accept messages out of order to ensure high availability and throughput.
notes: Need details explaining the streaming (kafka) approach vs the ASB/IQ.M approach

name: Exactly once message delivery
description: Most messaging systems that provide guaranteed delivery, including Azure Service Bus, will deliver messages multiple times in certain circumstances. Instead of attempting to force messages to be processed exactly once, message processors should be designed to be idempotent.
notes: Need details explaining the streaming (kafka) approach vs the ASB/IQ.M approach

name: Outbox pattern
description: The Outbox pattern allows a service to atomically publish messages without being temporally coupled to the messaging system. There is also tooling support for this pattern using the Foundation.Outbox Nuget package.

name: Redis
description: Redis is commmonly used as distributed cache.

name: Client Libraries
description: Owners of a service implement official client library(ies) to access their service in an effecient, fault tolerant manner.
notes: Maybe split for reasons why to use a client library and not use a client library

name: Auto incrementing Integer Ids
description: Auto incrementing integer ids introduce difficulties during fail-over or multi-writer distributed scenarios. They also complicate developing against non-prod systems and data sharding. Details

name: Azure Cosmos DB
description: CosmosDB has been found to be useful in some limited cases, but it's still way too expensive.
notes: Update w/ some details on good and poor usages in PE

name: Azure Functions
description: Azure Functions is Azure's answer to serverless computing. Using ASB triggers and Consumption plans, Azure Functions is a promising alternative to webJobs for low cost high scaling ASB message processing, as well as other short lived jobs. See function guidance.

name: MSSQL Server in the data center
description: Microsoft SQL is the primary supported RDBMS for relational database needs hosted in the Datacentres.
notes: Link to docs if we have them

name: Managed Instance SQL Server
description: [update me] Microsoft SQL hosted on azure VMs is no longer the recommended approach to hosting SQL databases in azure.

name: Azure Application Insights Custom Events
description: Application Insights custom events promise to collect custom usage data at very low cost. It has options for custom alerting.
notes: Pending decision on standard O11y tools

name: Figma
description: A collaborative web-based vector editor and UX design tool

name: Accessibility Standards
description: Products should be usable and useful to everyone despite any disabilities they may have. Check the Design Discipline Playbook for some resources on designing for colour blindness and other disabilities.

name: Failover testing
description: Failover tests independent of a current issue or incident allows for confidence in the environment's ability to withstand an event, and ensure people respond to the events appropriately.

name: npm
description: A popular JavaScript package manager. This should be the standard for managing a JS projects dependencies.

name: Yarn
description: An alternative JavaScript packages manager. In some cases it has additional features that make it useful but npm should be preferred in general.

name: React
description: A JavaScript component based UI library. New web apps should consider this the default choice for developing new projects.

name: React Native
description: A JavaScript  component based UI library for native mobile applications.

name: Backbone + Marionette (Hub v1)
description: A JavaScript library for RESTful model-view-presenter library and associated web application framework.

name: Aurelia (Hub v2)
description: A JavaScript application framework.

name: webpack
description: A JavaScript module bundler used to transform applications into distributable static assets.

name: Redux
description: A JavaScript flux-inspired application state management library.

name: Sass
description: A superset language of CSS. Less needed for applications built on the design system components but still useful.

name: Monorepo
description: A software repository pattern where multiple projects are all version controlled within a single repository. This simplifies making changes across multiple repositories, eases code reuse, and improves discoverability, at the cost of more noise and large storage requirements.

name: Typescript
description: A typed superset of the JavaScript language. Improves runtime safety at the expense of a stricter development process.

name: ECMAscript 6+
description: The modern JavaScript language. Including modules, classes, and many other syntax additions.

name: .NET Core 3.1
description: .NET Core 3.1 is the latest release and is fully supported by Microsoft.
notes: Add docs in product excellence repo

name: Azure Table Storage
description: Table Storage has been widely used by many dev teams. However, it is still not a good fit for some usage patterns.
notes: Update docs with concerns RE: DR and scale limits

name: Foundation Messaging
description: Foundation Messaging has been deprecated and replaced with IQ.Messaging for common service bus operations.

name: Azure Key Vault
description: Storing secrets unencrypted on disk (e.g. in web.config or appsettings.json files) is poor practice, and in some cases explicitly forbidden by contractual obligations. Azure Key Vault is a secure mechanism for storing secrets needed by applications.

name: ASP.NET Core
description: ASP.NET Core supports both .NET Core and .NET Standard as development platforms, and replaces ASP.Net for most/all purposes.

name: Event Sourcing
description: Event sourcing is a data modeling pattern where all events that led to the current state of a domain aggregate are stored instead of just storing the current state. The events are stored in an immutable and append only data store. Some techniques that this enables are: replaying all previous events when debugging problems, temporal querying where you can see the state of an aggregate at any point in time, replaying all events in order to build a new query projection. Challenges include: the loss of adhoc queryability of data, event versioning issues, problems reloading aggregates with large numbers of events.
notes: Update docs around what we are assessing?

name: Backend for Frontend pattern
description: A BFF is an API tightly coupled to a specific user experience. See https://samnewman.io/patterns/architectural/bff/

name: Managed Service Identity
description: See https://github.com/iQmetrix/product-excellence/blob/master/tech-radar/tools/managed-service-identity.md

name: IQ.RestClient
description: IQ.RestClient is an unsopported library which has mostly been replaced by modern ASP.Net Core capabilities for retry and other reliability patterns.

name: Azure App Services
description: With our investment into Docker and Kubernetes, it is no longer recommended to host services in Azure App Services.

name: F#
description: Functional techniques of immutability, pattern matching etc. are great.  We are not widely tooled up to support F# development and have no intention of broadly supporting it across teams.

name: NewRelic
description: New Relic is extensively used at iQmetrix for API performance monitoring and alerting.
notes: Pending decision on common O11y tools

name: Loggly
description: Loggly is a SaaS log aggregator in heavy use at iQmetrix.

name: TeamCity
description: Teams are encouraged to use Azure DevOps for new projects. Existing processes can remain in TeamCity.

name: RQ Sproc Bridge Service
description: The RQ Sproc Bridge Service allows code from outside RQ to call sprocs within the RQ Database. The sprocs should be created outside the dbo namespace, and are written, owned, and maintained by the team that calls them. Data that is accessed from a service via Sproc Bridge should be data that the service intends to own one day. These sprocs should be viewed as a temporary measure; calls to the Sproc Bridge Service should eventually be replaced by the service owning the data itself.

name: Azure DevOps
description: Azure DevOps combines source control, work item tracking, build and deploy, scrum tools, and more. See Azure Devops Documentation.

name: Service Broker
description: Use of SQL Service Broker to communicate out of the DC to Azure

name: GitHub
description: Create all new repos in Azure DevOps.  GitHub is widely used and we have no plans to abandon it.  We are almost at the repo cap and will not be paying for more capacity.

name: CQS
description: The Command Query Separation pattern is fundamentally about keeping queries side-effect free, ie: asking a question shouldn't change the answer. This principle aims to keep interfaces simple and the consequences of calling a method obvious.

name: IQ.Vanilla CQS AOP
description: Libraries such as IQ.Vanilla.CQS.AOP and Functional.CQS have been found to provide limited benefit and increased complexity. Unless you clearly need the benefits of Aspect Oriented Programming, consider instead creating simple and clear interfaces following the CQS principle.

name: Azure App Insights
description: O11y for Azure
notes: Pending decision on common O11y tools

name: Azure DevOps Pipelines
description: Pipelines and Releases are Microsoft's "classic" way of doing builds and deploys. Microsoft includes trigger support for repos in Azure DevOps and Github. Build and Deploy Guides

name: Azure DevOps YAML Pipelines
description: YAML pipelines are Microsoft's next generation way of doing builds and deploys. YAML pipelines still lack some important features, but in the long term they look very promising. Build and Deploy Guides

name: Appium + WinApp driver
description: Windows UI Test automation

name: Cypress
description: Browser UI Test automation

name: Detox
description: Mobile UI Test automation

name: Google Analytics
description: Web/Mobile Application analytics

name: Power BI for Internal Analytics
description: Using PowerBI for internal to IQ Data Analysis needs is encouraged.  Using it for external customer facing needs faces licensing and other issues and is still being Assessed.

name: Functional Patterns in C#
description: The Option, Result, and Discriminated Union patterns provided by the Functional library for C# help to avoid improperly handled null references or using exceptions to model failure

name: Sentry
description: Error and performance monitoring tool used for web applications

name: Web in RQ
description: A collection to libraries and techniques used to embed web applications into RQ

name: Design System
description: A collection of patterns and components used to design application interfaces

name: Taurus
description: Load testing tool

name: Locust
description: Load testing tool

name: Overops
description: Error logging and tracking for RQ services

name: HVR
description: Change data capture logging extraction tool

name: Delta Lake
description: Data Lake which allows upserts

name: Databricks
description: Processing engind ontop of Data/Delta Lake

name: Synapse DW
description: Massively Parallel Datawarehouse

name: Looker
description: Analytics for DnA

name: Sisense
description: Analytics for DnA

name: Tableau
description: Analytics for DnA

name: Embedded PowerBI
description: Analytics for DnA

name: MS Power Apps for Internal Consumption
description: No code approach to automate simple busines solutions in Azure.

name: MS Power Apps for External Use
description: There are many maintenance, versioning, compatibility issues to be overcome before Power Apps are ready for reliable delivery to customers.

name: Functional Patterns
description: Immutable types, pure functions, side-effect free functions, monadic composition, discriminated unions, result and option types, pattern matching, etc. to make code cleaner and easier to reason about

name: Feature Flags (Release Toggles)
description: Short lived toggles around in-development changes allowing latent code to be merged and shipped in order to improve continuous integration practices and enable trunk-based development, see this article for more info.

name: Blazor
description: Microsoft's solution for writing front-end web code using only C#; on Hold until it matures further, as it's still rather new
